Subject: LAST CALL: meeting date preference in 2010 - re: Heritrix Expert
 Summit
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=Nwsx6JE_YmlmeZQrBlcEOIUSTgAMCdczzsJGTVCpKz7f
X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

We're about to choose the final dates for a 2-3 day Heritrix Expert 
Summit in San Francisco, from among candidate dates in January-April of 
2010.

The idea of the summit is for advanced Heritrix crawl operators and
developers to share expertise and discuss the crawler's future 
evolution. (It is not a training/beginner session.)

If you are interested in attending, this is your last chance to fill out 
a calendar survey to help us choose possible dates. Please respond by 
this Friday, October 23, to ensure your input is considered.

Please include your contact info in the 'comment' field so we may reach 
you directly. (We will also announce details as they are settled back to 
this list, and it is not required to have answered the survey to attend.)

The survey is at:

http://beta.meetomatic.com/respond.php?id=M583B9

Please select one or more sets of 2-3 consecutive days which would be 
most convenient for you to attend.

Thanks!

- Gordon @ IA

Gordon Mohr wrote:
> We're continuing to search for the best dates for a 3-day Heritrix 
> Expert Summit in San Francisco, and are now considering dates in 
> January-April of 2010 as well as October of 2009.
> 
> We'd like to let everyone help pick the period that enables the widest 
> possible participation by advanced Heritrix crawl operators and developers.
> 
> If you are interested in attending, could you please fill out a small 
> survey about possible dates, and be sure to include your contact info in 
> the 'comment' field?
> 
> Select the three days upon which you would most like the meeting to fall 
> and then one to two alternative sets of three days. We would like to 
> start mid-day on day one, have a full day on day two and close with a 
> half day on day three, if feasible for those traveling from abroad.
> 
> http://beta.meetomatic.com/respond.php?id=M583B9
>
